檹字的基本解释

檹
yī
〔檹施〕树木茂盛或枝条长而柔软。
古书上说的一种树。

檹字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yī］
［《廣韻》於離切，平支，影。］
(1)树木柔曲不正貌。
(2)木名。即椅。
(3)树木修长貌。

檹字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　檹； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页558第45
【唐韻】於離切【類篇】於宜切，?音猗。【說文】木檹椸也。【玉篇】檹椸，長貌。又不正貌。　又【集韻】隱綺切，音椅。【說文】引賈侍中說：檹卽椅木，可作琴。

檹字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
檹字的起名意思

古书上说的一种树。也指树木茂盛或枝条长而柔软，如檹施。

Shao
Basic explanation of words
Shao
yī
〔檹施〕The trees are lush or the branches are long and soft.
A kind of tree mentioned in ancient books.
Shao
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yī］
["Guangyun" Yu Liqie, flat branch, shadow. ]
(1) The trees are soft and not upright.
(2) Wooden name. That is the chair.
(3) The trees are slender.
Shao
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji] [Wood Character Department] 　檹; Kangxi Strokes: 18; Page Number: Page 558, 45
[Tang Yun] Yu Liqie [Class Chapter] Yu Yiqie,? Yin Yi. [Said the text] Mu 檹椸 also. 【Jade articles】Liu lu, long appearance. Not upright.　[Jiyun] Hidden Qiqie, sound chair. [Said the text] Quoting Jia Shizhong said: The wooden chair can be used as a piano.
Shao
Source glyph
Character evolution: Xiaozhuan
Italics
Font comparison: Song Ti, Mainland China
Taiwan Minutes
Hong Kong Mingti
Korean Ming Dynasty
Shao
Name meaning
A kind of tree mentioned in ancient books. Also refers to trees that are lush or have long and soft branches, such as Shimushi.
yī
